snippet: The country has become a fulcrum of the refugees’ path toward Western and Northern Europe, shifting the course as conditions change and borders tighten or close.
abstract: Croatia's first parliamentary election since joining European Union in 2013 could result in tighter borders if conservative opposition party, who opposes unchecked flow of migrants through country, wins enough support.
lead_paragraph: The country has become a fulcrum of the refugees’ path toward Western and Northern Europe, shifting the course as conditions change and borders tighten or close.

headline.main: Croatia, Preparing to Vote, Takes Stock of Response to Migrant Crisis
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Croatia: Elections on Sunday

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
